div.p: This article is comprehensive, but lacks one major component—Russia. Russia has skin in the game of Asia. It has its disputed regions with Japan, it has a stake in controlling the DPRK and the nuclear threat from North Korea. It has a new very strategic economic relationship with China.
How do you write a major review of the last several years of the state of the East China and South China Sea disputes and leave Russia out?
Are you really from Larchmont?
Used to live in LA; one of my favorite places...

It does leave out Russia, but almost all of the disputes with China are occurring far to the southeast. While Russia does have a new economic agreement with China, I suspect that may a temporary expedient to secure one front while Putin strives to rebuild the old Soviet empire in the west. In the long run, Russia is demographically fading, while China is hungry for more land and resources - all tantalizingly available north of the Amur.

Disagree with several of your comments.
Russia is not rebuilding any Soviet empire. They are responding to the containment via NATO encroaching and US destabilizing via proxy Ukraine. Crimea is merely a return of what was always Russian, and Ukraine disintegration is natural due to corruption and its proxy status against Russia. You reap what you sow, and the Hegemon is reaping reaction to its attempts to destroy the Russian Federation.

China may be hungry for resources, but it's maritime reach is based on historical realities. The U.S. is desperate to maintain its naval hegemony, and China is nullifying that with its carrier-killer missile threat. A new Maritime Silk Road and a proposed canal through Thailand would eliminate the Straits of Malacca as a choke point the U.S. controls. Who is trying to limit who where? Its the US trying to stop China from being a true blue water naval power. The U.S. using an imperialistic Japan to torment China, Taiwan and South Korea in the Yellow Sea and East China Sea.

The 20th Century realities are gone. China and Russia will build a Eurasian market of over 3.5 billion people from the Far East and South Asia (India) to Russia and East Europe through Central Asia. This coming realty is what reduces the West and its corrupt EU, maniacal Nato, and collapsing American governmental tyranny to secondary position if they don't change from Hegemon to a multi-polar player.
Dig into the facts of the SCO, the New Silk Road, the Maritime Silk Road and look at the militarism of Abe's Japan and the use of the Philippines as proxy for the US.

China merely is the new bank for all emerging and most developing nations. A role once filled by a financially sound U.S. Now, the U.S. can only spread chaos and attempt de-stabilization to hold onto power. It's run as an empire is coming to an end. It may take ten more years, but debt will be the victor over the tyrant. The Liberals inherited the world and have destroyed it with their ideologies and wars.

Russia and China signed strategic economic and technological agreements far beyond the big gas deal. Now they are working on space, jumbo airliner, weapons, agriculture, rail, home construction, ports, bridges, pipelines, education, IT security, oil and gas and fresh water projects, food, currency, banking and finance (substitute for SWIFT and use of the Chinese credit card system). The Far East and Siberia, and Crimea and East Ukraine (now Novorossiya) are all areas of integration of Chinese and Russian development, as well as Northeast China (Heliongjiang Province) opening up to Russia projects.

Even India is getting Chinese investment for its infrastructure projects. If India wasn't so corrupt, they would have many more Chinese built ports and highways. The Chinese are going to modernize the India rail system.

The U.S. maybe thinks it can send Tweets and try to start some more color revolutions, but it has very little to offer to any but the most subservient nations. It is bringing down all its allies with debt and draconian Trade agreements. Look into TTIP and TTP and see how it colonizes any nation that joins. Pure hegemony in exchange for a nuclear umbrella and debt.
Yawn...

Oh I wish prose and thought when together but your writing belies too much anti-US bias to be taken as anything more than ranting. But from your screed it is clear that you really don't care about 'people' or 'rights' (China and Russia!) The Pax-China is about to end and Putin's bare chest and regressive policies are a bit hard to idolize.
But thanks for the rant - it made me laugh.
You almost had me nodding until you rambled about "liberals" and "their wars".
The F---? Man, you're holding out on us! Where do we get the good stuff??

I did get a laugh at the dig at India's (96/177 in the 2013 Corruption Perceptions Index) level of corruption, when corruption is just as endemic in both China (80/177) and especially Russia (127/177).
(By comparison, the United States' ranking is 19/177.)

And much of the economic growth in China has been fueled by the "shadow banking" system, which is functionally the equivalent of a house of cards built on quicksand.
There are other signifiicant challenges to the vision of economic integration outlined above, but I can't be bothered to write a W.O.T. at the moment.
Matthew,

For those who believe democracy cures all, China vs India is antithesis. Also in 1979, China's GDP and India GDP were the same despite India's smaller population. Now China is almost 5 times bigger than India's (nominal GDP). No Han Chinese dissidents live in the "largest democracy."
"Russia is not rebuilding any Soviet empire. They are responding to the containment via NATO encroaching and US destabilizing via proxy Ukraine."
You don't think this up yourself. You merely retype what your Russian paymasters send you.
It is written in such an old fashioned soviet era style that you ought to be ashamed - even with your on-line alias.
I hope you make a good living at it because you certainly appear to be stupid.
You are an idiot!
Go back downstairs and whack off again.
Year 2 will see some awakening of your own thoughts, it's OK, things will get better.

Russia has one of the largest oil and gas sectors of any nation. That large oil and gas sector, combined with the rest of Russia's economy ranks it right alongside Italy or California in GDP. And remember, Italy doesn't get to lean on oil and gas extraction to produce wealth.
Russia is busy in the Ukraine and saber rattling in the Baltic states.

When the whites of Europe, mainly the Brits sailed all over the world to take land and kill their people, it is deemed "ok". But when China sails as far as a mere few hundred miles south near Vietnam, oh no, the world sh-ts its pants.
What hypocrites.
So China's potential expansion at the cost of its Asian neighbors' territory is not a big deal because some people (who you consider hypocrites) didn't think colonialism was all that bad?

Frankly, Vietnam controls most of small islands in the South China Sea, Philippine the second, China the 3rd. We should respect the fact. Everyone knows U.S. tries to contain China to guarantee strategy advantage with all possible ways, it's not a problem. But the fact is quite different.

And you forgot to mention facts that all Chinese possessions in the South China Sea were resulted from recent invasions (Paracel/1974, 8 Spratly/ 1988, Mischief/1995 and Scarborough/2013) or China never controlled anything. So much for the fiction of Chinese historical ownership of SCS dated back to 1,000+ years.
White hyprocrisy: we kill nonwhites and claim democracy as justification, but People's Republic of China no allowed to spread true freedom and liberty to own territory, since they yellow
China is trying to spread freedom and liberty? Is that by censoring the internet or trying to pretend Tienanmen square never happened?
Please have more mercury in your baby formula.
Thanks for the stupid "straw man" attack.

Nobody here suggested that China is a democracy. What I and others have been saying is, American nationalists and jingoists are whining about China engaging in a very mild version of the gunboat diplomacy that has been engaged in by the United States, for over a century now. It was just fine and dandy when it was done by English-speaking white people, but oh, my goodness! We can't let those yellow Chinese play "our" little imperialist game.
Well, sorry, squire... nonsense propaganda of this type may play very well in Topeka, but it doesn't play very well at all in, say, Shanghai... not to mention Jakarta.

You are absolutely right as no Western media has ever attempted to report the belligerent behavior of Australia in its naked crime of stealing oil and gas in the territorial waters of Timor Leste. For the benefits of everyone, Timor Leste is a newly independent nation which broke off from Indonesia a decade or two ago.

Freedom and liberty? That's great!! Sincerely, you made my day, thank you very much ^^
Adapt censorship, arrest people who are making questions, kill cultural and religious minorities and force an integration of Han culture everywhere in the country is freedom?
No doubt you consider the caustic relation between east and west as a mere form of racism...
Nice alias. How's the weather in Beijing? Can you even see 100 meters down the street?
Hahaha.... "Frank John William"... parroting Chinese propaganda... "true freedom and liberty"... seriously, this is like a joke... do you honestly expect anyone to believe this crap?
Honestly, this is so ridiculous, it's like an SNL skit.
any idea how China became mostly Han ? read more.
For god's sake, everyone knows that. It's not hypocrisy, it's simply trying to oppose any expansion of power, in any way possible. In this case it's taking the rhetorical high ground.
And, of course, China will ignore it, and life will go on as usual.
This is real politik, my good man...
"But when China sails as far as a mere few hundred miles south near Vietnam, oh no, the world sh-ts its pants"

Uh no, not "the world." Rather, the leaders of Vietnam and the Philippines s**t in their pants. The current situation in the South China Sea would indeed be a non-issue IF all Southeast Asians were more than willing to roll over and submit to Chinese domination. The fact that they will not is something of an inconvenient problem for Beijing.
As long as America is willing to counterbalance China, they won't roll over.
The minute America is gone, they will.
Make that the instant... it won't take anywhere near a minute...
by then China will have imploded.
Tu quoque my good man!
Something the Chinese learned from their socialist friends to the North. "And you are lynching Negroes!"
So China can do whatever it wants because history.
Brilliant analysis. Now go collect your 50 cents from your PRC masters.

As usual when troll like you who has nothing to argue against a legitimate fact, will not mind sticking their head into the mud, accusing anyone of being PRC slave. They will never learn in life for sure.

'PRC slave'
You said it.
Who thought it was okay for whites of Europe to take land and kill people? There were wars. It just that the Europeans with modern weapons won.
We will see what price China is willing to pay to secure the territories in dispute.

International norms have changed since the 19th century. The 19th and 20th Century imperial powers (which included an enthusiastic Japan) caused such chaos and suffering that they themselves created a newer, better order. China doesn't need to prove, again, that aggressive colony building and military adventurism are destructive. We have enough of a reminder of that from the US as it is (but the US doesn't attempt territorial expansion, for whatever that's worth).
"The U.S. doesn't attempt territorial expansion."

That's a lie. (Haven't you heard of how various parts of the southern United States were violently taken from Mexico? Or how about the Phillipines. I'd suggest you read a few history books about the horrendous, colonialist violence inflicted on the indigenous populations there, on the part of successive generations of American imperialist occupiers.)

The United States has a tragic and disgraceful history of imperialist cruelty all over the world, particularly in Latin America. No amount of revisionist lying on the part of America propagandists is going to erase that history.
"History." Not current like China.
You realize that Mexico attacked US forces first, right?
Might have noticed, The Philippines aren't a US State or Territory. Puerto Rico keeps voting down independence.
But you really need to live in today's world, and leave the Soviet style 'whataboutism' behind.
Unless that's what you are getting paid to do.

div.blockquote: You realize that Mexico attacked US forces first, right?
div.p: I'm assuming you're referring to the Thornton Affair ? That may have provided a sufficient casus belli for Polk (along with Mexico's rejection of John Slidell's offer to forgive $3 million in debt for damages incurred during their war of independence in addition to paying $25-$30 million for Alta California and Santa Fe de Nuevo México), but it's virtually impossible to construe the Americans as anything other than the aggressors.

To do so would ignore America's repeated violations of Mexican sovereignty, such as John C. Frémont's military expedition into California in the winter of 1845-46, which culminated in him building a fort and raising the American flag at said fort. Afterwards, he went on to assist the Bear Flag Revolt. It also ignores American military intervention in the border dispute between Mexico and the Republic of Texas, as Polk sent 3,500 troops under Zachary Taylor in July 1845 to the Nueces River and authorized him to seize the disputed land by force if necessary.
In those ' violations of Mexican sovereignty ' how many Mexican Soldiers were killed?
Mexico had a tradition of border violations, see the Dawson Massacre, since they never recognized Texas independence or them joining the USA.
They didn't follow the Treaties of Velasco, dispite Santa Anna signing them.

You are correct. I am well aware of the US territorial conquests in the 19th and very early 20th centuries. I've read a number of good books on the subjects. Those events were also a long time ago when international norms were different. Since that age of imperialism, the world catastrophe of the mid 20th century has reshaped the world order to a better place. China is flouting this order now, not 100 years ago. Why does that make it OK for China to behave like the US or Japan behaved 100 years ago, when the history is clear that acting in such a way only leads to destruction and chaos? You cannot condemn the US for its history, and then turn around and use that history to excuse Chinese behavior in the present. THAT is classic propaganda doublethink.

So your solution is to continue shrugging off terrible acts because others have done them before?
Is it not possible that the world as a whole is now trying to set a better standard of behavior? China has had its imperialist moments before too: Xinjiang, Tibet, its foray into Vietnam and decades of propping up North Korea, even clashing with India in the southern Himalayas.
Didn't you know that India is part of China?
I'm pretty sure the Vietnamese aren't happy about other people encroaching on their sovreignty, regardless of whether they're White or Yellow.
Neither do Asians think that it's alright for Vietnam to claim the whole of South China Sea as its territorial rights.
get lost 50 cent chink

It's called the Law of the Sea Convention, and pretty much every country on earth subscribes to the same interpretation of the law--except for China. They want complete military dominion over the Exclusive Economic Zone (200 nautical miles from shore), which is something no one else agrees with. So please, don't speak for "Asians."
OK according to whom. There is no universal morality. That's why China's expansion is an issue, it doesn't share a moral system with other societies.
